column4: Small retail store owner tracks daily sales in Excel. Manager needs quick summary showing: total monthly sales (SUM), average daily sales (AVERAGE), highest single-day sales (MAX), lowest single-day sales (MIN). All four metrics visible at bottom of sales column for quick dashboard view.
column5: None - create sample data: 30 days of sales figures ($500-$5000)
column6: SUM(), AVERAGE(), MIN(), MAX() functions, basic function syntax, cell references, currency formatting with $ symbol
column9: Excel file with 30 days sales data + 4 summary formulas, formatted results screenshot, documentation (150 words explaining each function)

column4: Sales team analyzing product contribution to total revenue. Each product row shows revenue, need column showing "% of Total Revenue". First product might be $50,000 of $200,000 total = 25%. Requires absolute reference to total so formula copies correctly to all rows.
column5: None - create 10 products with revenue values
column6: Relative references (A1, B2), absolute references ($A$1), mixed references ($A1, A$1), understanding when to lock rows/columns, F4 key for cycling reference types
